title: Piers Morgan reveals his drink was spiked when he was in a nightclub in his 20s
text:
Piers Morgan has revealed his drink was spiked when he was in his 20s and he never found out who the culprit was.

The TV presenter, 54, made the surprising admission during Wednesday's edition of Good Morning Britain while discussing the group Extinction Rebellion bringing some of central London to a stand still by setting up a rave.

After his co-host Susanna Reid joked she would 'love to set up a rave', Piers informed her that he once spent eight hours straight dancing after his drink was tampered with on a night out.

Admission: Piers Morgan has revealed his drink was spiked when he was in his 20s and he never found out who the culprit was during Wednesday's Good Morning Britain

He said: 'The last time I danced like that was in my early twenties when somebody slipped something into my drink.'

While the panel giggled awkwardly, Susanna appeared concerned by Piers' admission.

He went on: 'Erm, they did. I never found out what it was but I danced like for about eight hours.'

Extinction Rebellion have been involved in a number of protests in London over the last number of days with more than 500 people arrested.

Piers' admission comes as he recently asked a personal trainer to help him lose weight.

On Tuesday's episode of Good Morning Britain, Piers was inspired by guest Darren 'Dibsy' McClintock's 20 stone weight loss after his PT Mike Hind handed out leaflets to local takeaways begging them not to serve his client.

Talking to the duo about their inspirational milestone, Piers joked: 'You couldn't do a bit of work with me, could you?

He said: 'The last time I danced like that was in my early twenties when somebody slipped something into my drink'

'Banned at Kensington McDonald's, don't serve him a Big Mac! My local wine store, don't let him have the Bordeaux, ban this man!'

Piers and his co-host Susanna Reid spoke to Darren, who used to weigh 40 stone, during the episode.

Good Morning Britain continues on weekdays at 6am on ITV.
